page.title: 06SAILING IN STOKE GABRIEL
page.content: In Stoke Gabriel there is a Boating Association. In the Junior section the boats are called Optimists, Toppers, and Mirrors. The mirrors are used for two people to sail. If you use your own boat you have to pay thirty pence but if you use the club's own boats then you have to pay a little more. If you need rescuing there is a rescue service that will come to you very quickly. We meet every week-end in the summer, but we don't sail in the winter because the water is too cold. When we meet at the clubhouse we talk about the season and the boats that need painting. Every month we have a talk by a local man. At the end of the season we go to the clubhouse for the club awards.
